snippet: Rewarding your fellow passengers for putting up with noise and discomfort isn’t unfair. It’s an example of the way people and businesses build social capital....
abstract: The Upshot; Damon Darlin Economic View column notes that recommendation on parenting blogs to distribute small gifts to fellow airplane passengers in order to endear them to young children is good idea, one that signals to other passengers that parents care about their comfort.
lead_paragraph: Rewarding your fellow passengers for putting up with noise and discomfort isn’t unfair. It’s an example of the way people and businesses build social capital.

headline.print_headline: Parents, Break Out the Goody Bags
headline.main: Flying With Shrieking Children? Give Your Neighbors a Goody Bag
